thread.title: Tourism officials, businesses say 2015 shaping up strong
thread.title_full: Tourism officials, businesses say 2015 shaping up strong

title: Tourism officials, businesses say 2015 shaping up strong
text:
South Dakota officials, businesses say 2015 shaping up to be strong year for tourism in state 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 8/28/15 5:38 pm EDT - Updated: 8/28/15 5:41 pm EDT 
PIERRE, South Dakota â€” Officials say tourism is surging so far this year in South Dakota, spurred on by landmark events such as the 75th Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, good weather and reasonable gas prices. 
Expectations for 2015 have been high because of key events like the rally and the 50th annual Buffalo Roundup at Custer State Park. 
The state Tourism Department noted nearly $350 million in tourism taxable sales for this year at the end of July, which is more than 14 percent higher than the same period last year. 
Kirk Hulstein is research and visitor services manager at the department. He says indicators show that 2015 could be "one of our biggest years ever." 
Southeast South Dakota Tourism executive director Jacquie Fuks (FOOKS) says good weather and gas prices have also helped.
